articles.description: Football's world governing body Fifa is warned players are willing to go on strike if they continue to be overworked.
articles.title: Players could strike if Fifa fails to listen to them - PFA chief

articles.description: England sign off for the T20 World Cup with a seven-wicket thrashing of Pakistan at The Oval.
articles.title: England v Pakistan: Hosts sign off for World Cup with seven-wicket win

articles.description: Former Barcelona and Manchester United defender Gerard Pique is placed under official investigation in a corruption case in Spain.
articles.title: Gerard Pique: Ex-Barcelona and Manchester United defender under investigation in corruption case

articles.description: Daniil Medvedev progresses to the French Open third round after his opponent Miomir Kecmanovic retires from their match.
articles.title: French Open 2024 results: Daniil Medvedev through after Miomir Kecmanovic retires

articles.description: Jofra Archer looks like he has never been away while Mark Wood finds form to bring the "excitement" to England's T20 World Cup defence.
articles.title: England v Pakistan: Jofra Archer and Mark Wood bring 'excitement' before T20 World Cup

articles.description: Great Britain's Matthew Hudson-Smith beats his own 400m European record with a convincing victory in his season opener at the Diamond League in Oslo.
articles.title: Diamond League in Oslo: Matthew Hudson-Smith wins 400m with European record time

articles.description: World number one Nelly Korda has an opening round to forget at the Women's US Open after finding water three times to card a horror 10 on the par-three 12th hole at Lancaster Country Club in Philadelphia.
articles.title: US Women's Open: Nelly Korda 10 over par after round one

articles.description: The French Open has stopped fans drinking alcohol in the stands in a bid to end unruly behaviour, says tournament director Amelie Mauresmo.
articles.title: French Open 2024: Fans banned from taking alcohol into Roland Garros stands

articles.description: The England and Wales Cricket board will sell stakes in the eight Hundred teams later this year and says the competition “will play a vital role in the future of our sport”.
articles.title: The Hundred: ECB will sell stakes in eight teams later this year

articles.description: Kieran McKenna signs a new four-year deal to remain in charge of Ipswich Town after overseeing their rise to the Premier League.
articles.title: Kieran McKenna: Ipswich Town manager signs new four-year deal
